title: Britain's Smart Cities conference sponsorship
text: Find out more about the Britain's Smart Cities » Gold sponsor Heathrow is the UK’s hub airport, home to more than 80 airlines connecting to more than 180 destinations. Every year Heathrow welcomes over 70 million passengers with a commitment to "making every journey better". Following the Airports Commission’s recommendation for its expansion, Heathrow is making its case to build an additional runway at the airport and keep the UK at the heart of the global economy. Get in touch In our increasingly urbanised society, Britain’s city leaders are major stakeholders in developing a highly interconnected and dynamic environment for business success. Britain’s Smart Cities will showcase how world-class urban projects are enabling city leaders to drive business growth. Speakers will illustrate how smart city development is not just about cost efficiencies and sustainability within urban infrastructure; it also creates the foundation and culture for commercial success. Those attending will include mayors and senior executives from city councils across the UK. There will also be major participation from construction, technology, financing, legal, consulting and architectural firms who have dedicated teams actively focusing on smart city development. If you would like to find out about becoming a commercial partner for the conference please contact christopher.warren@telegraph.co.uk .
